alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 04 at 9:35AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine, including the following areas, Coastal York and Interior York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Cheshire, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham, Merrimack, Strafford, Sullivan and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Portions of southern New Hampshire and far southwest Maine have had multiple rounds of heavy rainfall over the last few days. More showers and isolated thunderstorms will cross the region today with locally heavy downpours. Flash flooding may occur along with sharp rises on small rivers and streams.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
